Return to the shore and walk along the brick esplanade connecting to the Sydney Opera House. Your guide greets you in front of the shimmering glass panels wrapping around the lobby. Before entering the building, you learn about the history of the grand structure, including the reason for the textured rooftop. The crenulated and tiered shapes resemble sails to capture the seaside ambiance of the city. Once inside, you notice the tangible splendor of the design. The main gallery resembles an oyster and has remarkable acoustics due to the size, which maintains 2,000 seats.

dayInfo.title: Christchurch – Kia Ora, New Zealand
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the café culture of Sydney returns to life with locals venturing to indulge in salted honey tarts and chocolate fudge cake while sipping their coffee. At breakfast, you delight in your view over Circular Quay as the Central Business District teems with business people venturing to work and shops opening their doors. Your private transfer leads you to Sydney Airport for your flight to Christchurch, New Zealand. The city on the South Island offers a mixture of European ambiance and the gorgeous scenery for which the country is known. Art projects decorate the streets of the city center and the Botanic Gardens around Hagley Park add layers of extra color to the combination of antique stone structures and shimmering modern architecture. Punters glide down the Avon River beneath the dangling trees. After settling into the comforts of your luxury hotel, you traverse the city accompanied by your guide, culminating in a gondola ride to the top of Mount Cavendish. The cable car travels for nearly 3,100 feet to reach the 1,640-foot summit. From the top, you have a dramatic view spanning the city and reaching the surrounding Canterbury Plains.

dayInfo.title: Franz Josef – Discovering the South Island
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the sunlight washes over the Re:START Mall, an area that was rebuilt after the 2011 earthquake to revitalize the downtown area. The 29 stores and single café built out of shipping containers helped re-establish the city center as a chic, inviting, and exciting place to visit for locals and visitors alike. After breakfast, your private transfer escorts you to the train station to board the celebrated TranzAlpine train. The tracks travel nearly 150 miles through 19 tunnels to reach the Greymouth. You relax in the comforts of your train car for the duration of the scenic ride west. The beauty of untamed New Zealand abounds outside the window, beginning with the sweeping colors of the Canterbury Plains. The grassland shimmers with green and gold spreading over the hills. You find the marvels of the Southern Alps peeking through the sporadic clouds in the distance. The train travels through Arthur’s Pass. Beech forest thrives in the cooler climate and frames the township near the Bealey River. The pass reaches a height of more than 2,400 feet above sea level. You disembark the train upon reaching Greymouth. Before traveling south to reach the town of Franz Josef, your guide leads you on a short drive north, passing the dairy farms and small symbols of rugged hills to reach the Punakaiki Pancake Rocks. The stunning black sands on the beach lead to captivating views of the cliffs with layered limestone that looks like tall stacks of pancakes. The sea air offers a soothing aroma amidst the sporadic bursts of water spouting from the powerful blowholes.

dayInfo.title: Franz Josef – Visions of the South Island Glaciers
dayInfo.description: The aromas of buttery pastries and fresh jam drift through the doors of Picnics Bakery in the morning. You delight in a fresh cup of refreshing coffee before meeting your guide in the lobby of your hotel. You make your way to the helipad where the propellers of the helicopter are warming up. The rush of air chills your cheeks as you step aboard the helicopter ready to lift into the air. The pilot offers insightful commentary about the landscape as you travel through the mountain gully. The rugged terrain frames the undulating ice field that travels over seven and a half miles. The chopper lands on a plateau. You strap crampons to your feet and follow your guide onto the ice of Franz Josef to continue your unforgettable glacial excursion. The sound of your feet crunching the ice fills the air. The shallow breeze bites your cheeks, carrying sporadic flecks of frost. From a distance, the glacier looked smooth against the black granite peaks. While walking atop the ice, you find a more grainy texture, similar to packed snow. You enter into a natural tunnel. The pure, untouched ice glows unfathomable indigo in the beams of sunlight pouring through the mouth of the passageway.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – The Scene of the South Island
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you can’t help but think of the light bouncing off the pristine blue ice inside the tunnel. Remembering the helicopter ride over the glacier makes your heart race with excitement. The scent of fresh coffee brings you back to breakfast where you meet your private transfer. After the meal, you set out on a scenic drive south towards the magnificent city of Queenstown, celebrated for the beauty of the surrounding mountains and reflective waters of Lake Wakatipu. The route leads you along the winding roads of Glacier Country. The lush forest grows alongside the roadway and frames the snowcapped mountain peaks in the distance. Stop along the road through Haast Pass to find Fantail Falls. The cascade divides the forest with a delta-like stream pouring over silver granite for nearly 50 feet. The crystal clear pool waits below. You can also visit the marvelous Blue Pools, known for their crystal clear indigo hues created from the meltwater from the surrounding glaciers. You make another stop in the Gibbston Valley, a famous branch of the Otago wine-growing region. Steep cliffs grow alongside the valley floor where vines thrive in the cool climate. You can take a moment to enjoy the refreshing, fruity notes of a celebrated Pinot Noir with a view to the valley floor before continuing to the shores of Lake Wakatipu in Queenstown.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Enchanting Milford Sound
dayInfo.description: The sunlight washes over the reflective waters of Lake Wakatipu in the morning. The Remarkables Mountains reach into the sky along the southeastern shores of the water. The gondola returns to a circling steep ascent to the top of Bob’s Peak, which travels at a 220-degree angle to reach the nearly 1,500-foot tall summit. The scent of fresh snow blends with the aroma of strong coffee drifting out of a café. Your guide greets you at the hotel and escorts you south along the secluded scenic road to reach the banks of Milford Sound. Melted glaciers shaped the fjord, creating marvelous peaks, sensational waterfalls, and the crowning summit of Mitre Peak at 5,550 feet above sea level. Pebbles pave the shoreline leading to granite boulders reflected in the placid surface water. Your boat cruises along the fjord with your captain exclaiming how the famous British author Rudyard Kipling declared the enchanting scenery, “the Eighth Wonder of the World.” Seals lounge on the rocks and bathe in the sun. Crested penguins leap out of the water. Their yellow crests stand out against the black and white plumage. The sound of rushing water grips you as you pass Lady Elizabeth Bowen Falls, which stands at more than 530 feet above sea level while providing Milford Sound with power and water.

dayInfo.title: Tahiti – Maeva in French Polynesia
dayInfo.description: The scent of sizzling bacon offers a comforting ambiance in the cool outside temperatures of the South Island. The lobby of your resort offers a warming, roaring fire as you take in the scenic view of the Remarkables Mountains. Indulge in the pleasures of a decadent hot chocolate to embrace the alpine charm of Queensland. The morning is yours to enjoy the town at your leisure. Walk along the pine-knotted buildings or stroll around the shores of Lake Wakatipu along the promenade. You could also take some time to view the Underwater Observatory. The popular site acts as a reverse aquarium, allowing visitors to walk through a series of glass panels looking into the deep waters of the lake. Freshwater eels emerge from hidden coves and ducks dive down into the cold water in search of unsuspecting trout. Your private transfer meets you in the hotel lobby when you are ready and escorts you to Queenstown Airport for your flight to Tahiti, French Polynesia. You arrive in the evening and find the island awake with the scent of coconut and the sounds of the lapping water. The warm, tropical night contrasts the alpine climate on New Zealand’s South Island. Your private transfer escorts you to the hotel to relax in the exotic landscape amidst the tranquil, soothing sounds of the South Pacific Sea.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Delights of Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: The sea breeze rustles the coconut palms soaring above the black sands of Tahiti. The market in Papeete brims with colorful fruits, from mangos to guavas, pineapples to dragon fruits. Pearl shops open their doors along the second level, sparkling with precious stones shaped by oysters. After a refreshing breakfast accentuated by the delectable exotic fruits of the island, your private transfer escorts you to the airport for your brief flight to magnificent Bora Bora. The island radiates serenity and charm embodied in the emerald rainforest, black basalt mountain peaks, and crystal clear turquoise water spanning the shallow lagoon. You meet your private transfer at the airport and travel across the lagoon by boat, arriving at a stylish comfort with an iconic French Polynesian overwater bungalow. Dig your toes into the hot white sand on the private beach and embrace the marvelous colors of the blossoming Tahitian gardenias. You return to the main shores of the island for a 4x4 jeep safari offering you secluded panoramas and hidden histories beneath the soaring peak of Mount Otemanu. Avocado and mango trees thrive in the tropical climate, planted by villages in the rainforest terrain. You travel along the unpaved inland roads, ascending the hills to reach a World War II defensive gun looking out over the lagoon. You can see the outline of Raiatea Island in the distance. The rusted but strong metal outlines the preserved gun secured by the US Navy to protect the island from the Japanese invasion. The dangling branches frame the remarkable view of the white sand and stunning South Pacific Sea. In the evening, the rhythmic drums of a Polynesian dance performance call you to dinner.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Sharks on the Lagoon
dayInfo.description: The scent of coconut permeates the sea breeze drifting through the windows of your overwater bungalow. You have a secluded view of Mount Otemanu and its twin peak of Mount Pahia. After breakfast, you board a traditional outrigger canoe on the resort’s shores to begin your guided snorkeling private tour of the stunning lagoon. The sea spray splashes over the hull of the boat. The tropical sunlight is already warm on your skin. The lush, verdant rainforest on the island is always within view as you traverse the crystal clear lagoon in search of reef bodies and coral gardens. After diving into the water at two other sites, the salt begins to form crystals on your shoulders. You reach your final site on the tour, famous for the abundance of manta rays and sharks bold enough to swim next to your boat. Before jumping into the lagoon, you can see the dorsal fin of blacktip reef sharks, immediately understanding their nomenclature based upon the black spot tipping the dorsal fin. The warm, refreshing water offers visibility up to 20 feet in front of you, allowing you to observe the brilliance of the five-foot-long sharks and the giant manta rays whose wingspans can grow up to 23 feet wide.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Whale of a Time in Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: The morning light washes over the beauty of the island, returning the jewel-like splendor of the rainforest, mountains, and waters. At breakfast, you bask in the refreshing aroma of coffee made from beans cultivated in the hills of French Polynesia. The day is yours to indulge in the beauty of island life at your preferred pace. Rest with a soothing massage in the celebrated spa at your resort or traverse the circular road around Bora Bora on a bicycle to explore hidden beaches and delightful restaurants. You travel by boat across the lagoon to reach the marina at Vaitape. Board a 21-foot long catamaran and set sail on the deep waters of the South Pacific Sea in search of migrating humpback whales. The boat manages to stay within view of the shores of Bora Bora offering a different perspective of the twin peaks of Otemanu and Pahia. Your captain offers insight into the lives of the whales and how they pass through the archipelago upon returning from the Antarctic waters. Females can grow up to 52 feet long with dark gray skin and white patches around their stomachs. A nearby splash demands your attention. You turn towards the island where a full-grown humpback breaches the water, managing an elegant pose before crashing back into the sea.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – A Grand Ending to the South Pacific Vacation
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you recall the elegance with which the humpback sprung from the water during your whale watching tour the previous day. The luscious scent of coconut and citrusy pineapple brings you back to the delectable flavors of Bora Bora. You delight in fresh banana pancakes, which accentuate the tropical ambiance of the morning light. When you are ready, your private transfer escorts you across the lagoon to Vaitape. You have a chance to visit a local pearl shop. The boutique is known for its vibrant collection of precious stones ranging from white to green and black to purple. A representative of the shop greets you like an old friend and offers insight into the cultivation of pearls across French Polynesia. They invite you into the workshop to see how they craft each piece of jewelry to best accompany the size, shape, and color of the pearl. After visiting the workshop, you continue to the Bora Bora Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Luxury Bora Bora Vacation Tour: Private Polynesian Cooking Class to Sunset Cruise
generalInfo: Embrace the adventure of island splendor during your luxury Bora Bora vacation. Soar over the lush rainforest canopy on a helicopter ride. Glide above the indigo colors of the famous lagoon while parasailing. Rush across the calm waters of the South Pacific riding Jet Skis and float over a coral garden as sharks and manta rays swim nearby. The sweet aromas of exotic fruits fill the air. Pearls shimmer in the blissful sunlight. Combine excitement and relaxation, tropical seclusion and modern luxury, with unforgettable excursions and inspiring sunsets on the idyllic island of Bora Bora.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Adventures in French Polynesia
dayInfo.description: Bora Bora is an island of majesty and adventure, from volcanic craters to emerald jungle canopies, radiant exotic flowers and glistening waters ranging from turquoise to indigo. The Central market in Vaitape glows with the colors of tropical fruits, highlighting mango, guava, and pineapple. The scent of creamy banana drifts down the aisles. The upper floor contains pearl vendors offering insight into the sheen and prestige of the precious stone. Fishermen showcase their daily catch for passersby, and the aroma of the ocean remains prevalent along the coastal road. Your flight lands at Bora Bora Airport, where your private transfer greets you upon your arrival. You take a boat across the shimmering crystal clear and indigo waters of the celebrated lagoon to reach the secluded luxury of your five-star accommodation. You settle into the comforts of an iconic overwater bungalow. The thatched roof connects the traditional culture and style of the island with contemporary luxuries. You have a view to the east and the basalt peak of Mount Otemanu. A raised wooden walkway connects your suite to the hotel along the island shores. Coconut palms shade the infinity pool looking out to the bungalows. After getting acquainted with your hotel grounds, you return to the shores of Bora Bora for an introduction to the historical sites along the east coast. At Marae Aehautai, you find one of the oldest temples on the island, dating back more than a millennium. The stone slab marks the base of the temple grounds in view of the soaring peak of Mount Otemanu. In the distance, your guide points to the outlines of Raiatea and Taha’a Islands.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Thrills of Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of coconut filters through your suite over the water. Enjoy a relaxing breakfast amongst the bright colors of passion fruit and pineapple accompanying the scent of frothy cappuccino. The semi-sweet flavor of banana pancakes adds to the tropical ambiance of your surroundings. After the meal, you travel to the Vaitape pier to begin your first Jet Ski excursion on the island. Your guide greets you on the water before leading you across the clear South Pacific Sea. The water is cool and refreshing on your skin. The tropical light casts a shimmer over the surface of the South Pacific. The Jet Ski roars to life, and you follow your guide to the indigo hues of the lagoon. The Jet Ski causes the water to splash against your skin. The coastline contains rugged beauty deriving from the undulating hills, verdant rainforest, and visible silver basalt rocks. Mount Otemanu reaches a height of nearly 2,400 feet above sea level, striking a dramatic backdrop to the colorful lagoon. The sands shimmer with powdery white sand along the beaches. Stop at a spot along the shore to watch one of the locals husk a coconut. They place a sharp stake into the sand before piercing the husk with the point. They spin the coconut, peeling away the splintery husk like the layers of an onion. Then they cut the coconut clean in half by slamming it against a rock. You try your hand at the husk and find it is far more difficult than the demonstrator made it look.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Life and Wonder on the Lagoon
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you find the scent of hibiscus blending with the semi-sweet aroma of the sea. The breeze rustles through the coconut palms along the shore and the thistles of your thatched roof dangling above the open windows. After breakfast, you return to the Vaitape pier to once again board a Jet Ski. The scenery around the lagoon continues to captivate you, crowned by the sensational peak of Mount Otemanu and the equally impressive summit of Mount Pahia, the latter of which reaches a height of nearly 2,200 feet above sea level. You stop for lunch at a famous restaurant, known for its colorful features inside a traditional Tahitian hut. A sand floor welcomes visitors beneath a thatched roof. Tiki torches burn along the edges of the restaurant, and the seats are crafted out of palm trees. The restaurant is known for cooking some of the freshest and most delicious seafood on the island. The scent of butter, coconut, and lime drifts through the dining room. You return to the water on a speedboat bound for the shallows known for harboring blacktip reef sharks and manta rays. You jump into the inviting water, wearing fins and a snorkel eager to view the vibrant life in the water. Seeing the five-foot long sharks swimming near you at first feels daunting. Your heart thumps loudly in your chest. The shark ignores you, and you quickly find the beauty and thrill of swimming close enough to the shark to see its grace and power.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – A Different Thrill
dayInfo.description: Listen to the gentle water lapping against the wooden posts of your overwater bungalow in the morning. The serene sound accentuates the natural splendor and welcoming ambiance of your tropical paradise. After breakfast, you set out onto the water with your guide eager to learn the art of stand-up paddleboard. You begin on the white sand along the beach, learning the proper way to stand on the nearly 11-foot long board. The sand begins to heat up beneath the tropical sun. The breeze brushes against your cheeks and causes a coconut to fall from the canopy. You grip the paddle with one hand at the top and the second hand around the post. You position your elbows at 90 degrees, practicing propelling yourself forward from the sand. Once you feel comfortable, you follow your instructor onto the water, immediately noticing the difference in balance. You keep your body upright with the paddle at an easy angle. The calm lagoon helps you regain your equilibrium while standing at the center of the board. You rotate your body with each stroke of the paddle, easily finding ways to turn the paddle away from the wake. In the afternoon, you venture to a resort on the lagoon to meet with a private chef keen on introducing you to the flavors of French Polynesia during a specialty cooking class. Once inside the kitchen, you find the aromas of coconut, pineapple, and chocolate before discovering fresh tuna bought earlier that day from the market.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Sailing into the Sunset
dayInfo.description: You have become accustomed to the luxuries of your accommodation and the magnificent beauty of Bora Bora. At breakfast, you bask in the sensual aroma of a fresh cappuccino and delicious banana pancakes topped with mango. The day is yours to experience island life as you desire, from basking on the secluded white sands of Eden Beach to venturing through the jungles at the heart of the island of a 4x4 jeep safari. Enjoy the bright light and vibrant hues of the resort at leisure before boarding a private boat for a cruise around the lagoon and South Pacific Sea. The boat fills with the fragrance of tropical fruit, consisting of guava, pineapple, and banana. The sea breeze rushes over the hull of the boat and along the shoreline, rustling the coconut palms and rainforest leaves. The traditional outrigger canoe offers a unique, intimate experience along the water. You travel around the coastline for an unfettered view of the western horizon. You can look into the crystal waters around the reefs to find angelfish and parrotfish grazing near the coral. The sun begins to set, casting layers of pink, purple, red, and orange across the sky. The colors match the exotic hues radiating daily from the island in the form of fruits and flowers. Sip sparkling wine in the colorful display of sunset. You continue to a stunning restaurant overlooking the lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Underwater and In the Air
dayInfo.description: After a quiet breakfast, you return to the adventures of French Polynesia with an Aquabike tour. You traverse the lagoon to meet your guide on the beach. You mount the motorized scooter and place the glass bubble secular over your body. The pressurized seal keeps your head dry as you follow the secured path nearly 10 feet beneath the surface. A scuba diver guides you along the route, as you notice the shadow of the scooter moving along the ocean floor. Starfish cling to the submerged rocks and sea cucumbers puff bubbles into the crystal clear waters. Schools of sergeant majors and pennant bannerfish swim close to the coral. The latter have a long, white dorsal fin fluttering like a banner in the gentle current. You have a peaceful journey beneath the sea, immersed in the water and the beauty of subaquatic Bora Bora. After lunch, you step aboard a boat bound for the waters near Matira Beach. You can see manta rays swimming in the crystal clear hues of the lagoon. The scenic route on the water offers a splendid foreground to your panoramic view once you drift into the air while parasailing. Like the thrilling, yet serene time beneath the water, the tranquil atmosphere in the air allows you to fully appreciate the beauty of Bora Bora.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – A Lasting Impression
dayInfo.description: The bright turquoise waters of the lagoon reflect light through your windows in the morning. The tropical charms of Bora Bora continue to intrigue you, accompanied by the fascinating adventures across the Polynesian island. At breakfast, you indulge in the flavor of a frothy cappuccino, accentuated by the sweet scent of coconut. You make your way to the main shores of the island to board a helicopter bound for the skies. Your heart once again beats with anticipation but fades beneath the sound of the propellers roaring to life. The helicopter ascends into the air, and you have a spectacular view of the verdant grass around Vaitape, leading to the undulating jungle terrain at the center of the island. You swoop over the basalt peak of Mount Otemanu to find the unconquered, swelling surface covered with foliage crowning the steep silver and black cliffs. The flight continues over the radiant indigo and turquoise waters circling Bora Bora and eventually leading you to the island of Tupai. The secluded shores glisten with white sands. Your pilot points to the reefs around the coastline, accounting for the shallow bodies enclosed by the sapphire hues of the deeper South Pacific. Coconut palms resemble the rainforest canopy around the four square miles of the island. The helicopter lands on the flight pad in Bora Bora. You return to the comforts of your accommodation with the remainder of the day focused on refreshing your body and mind after the unforgettable adventures.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – End of the French Polynesian Escapades
dayInfo.description: You take the time to enjoy the little pleasures of your last breakfast in Bora Bora. You absorb the aromas of fresh passion fruit and guava. You notice the thin, delicate texture of your fluffy pancakes with exceptional real banana flavors. After the meal, you take to the white sand beach and try paddle boarding once more. The mixture of exhilaration and tranquility returns, allowing you to enjoy relaxing on the gentle wake of the lagoon. The views of the soaring peaks of Otemanu and Pahia mountains continue to draw your eye. The memories of your time on Bora Bora, from swimming with blacktip reef sharks to soaring over the lagoon on a parasail, remain at the forefront of your mind as your private transfer escorts you to Bora Bora Airport for your flight home.

tourName: Moorea, Bora Bora and Taha'a Itinerary: 12-Days of Bliss
generalInfo: The fantastical landscape of your French Polynesian honeymoon itinerary surpasses your daydreams, with secluded thatched-roof bungalows overlooking the sapphire waters of the South Pacific. The sounds of a gentle ukulele offer a morning serenade. In the evening, you watch fire-jugglers, and traditional dancers perform on the soft sands of the beach to the rhythms of beating drums. Colorful fish glow against the artistic formations of the sprawling coral. Mountains crown the islands with remnants of volcanoes, and you bask in the soothing touch of a couple’s spa treatment. Indulge in romance, beauty, and enchantment on Tahiti, Moorea, Bora Bora, and Taha’a.

dayInfo.title: Papeete – A Slice of Island Paradise
dayInfo.description: The lush palms and tall grasses of Papeete shimmer with emerald hues as your flight descends into the airport. The Pacific Ocean shimmers with iridescent indigo colors, as thatched-roof huts rise out of the jetties along the marina. Boat masts wade in the gentle waters as the palm trees rustle in the calm breeze. Your flight arrives at Faa’a International Airport. Colorful impressionist works by famous French painter Gauguin decorate the airy galleries in the eponymous museum. Dramatic wooden Tikis rise out of the lavish gardens and entertain visitors with ancient myths and tales warning people not to move the unforgettable carved artworks. The aroma of sweet salt water permeates the air. The bustling life of the Papeete Market creates a swirl of color emanating from handmade sarongs and shell necklaces, woven hats, and the array of produce picked from the trees and bushes around the countryside. The sweet, juicy aroma of coconuts and pineapples drifts beneath the banisters, leading locals to the aisles of fishmongers and butchers. Pearl shops line the lanes of the upstairs and caves offer rich espressos and vivacious, citrusy smoothies. Your private transfer greets you at customs and escorts you to a secluded resort, offering you the romance of a private view of the lapping water and the charm of slow-paced island life blending the essential cultures of the islands of French Polynesia.

dayInfo.title: Papeete – Adventure to the Center of Paradise
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can hear the Pacific Ocean brushing against the volcanic black sands of the beach outside your room. At breakfast, you find the enticing, seductive aromas of frothy cappuccino and young coconut. You sip a freshly squeezed passion fruit juice and smell the scent of banana pancakes adding to the tropical ambiance of the morning air. Your guide greets you after breakfast, eager to lead you on a full-day 4x4 tour. The vibrant life of Papeete returns in the municipal market. The scent of vanilla bean accentuates the tropical colors of the sarongs. You travel into the heart of the island of Tahiti in an open-air jeep, allowing the refreshing breeze to brush against your cheeks. The island was formed over a million years ago by volcanic activity around the Pacific. The ferns and underbrush glisten with emerald hues. Children in villages wave as you pass. The jungle vegetation becomes denser. The sporadic villages disappear behind the dangling branches and soaring jungle canopy. The jeep crosses over a wooden bridge. The sound of the meandering river rushes around the pillars. Clouds pass the verdant mountain summits framing the valley. You stop along the riverbanks located higher up the mountainside and dip your toes into the cold water fed by the rain sweeping down the slopes before arriving at Puraha Waterfall.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Romance in Moorea
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of fresh cappuccino returns to the air inside the resort dining room. You bask in the privacy of your room, coveting one last view of the Tahiti shoreline. The indigo water shimmers against the black sand beach. Your private transfer greets you after the meal and escorts you to the harbor to board the high-speed ferry to Moorea. The water splashes against the hull of the boat, causing a soft mist to spray against the windows. The water turns from indigo to cobalt as you travel the 10 miles around the French Polynesian islet to reach Moorea. As you pass Cooks Bay, you have an unforgettable panorama of the clear indigo water framed by the tropical jungle brush and staggering mountain ridges. You turn your eyes to the jagged summits beneath the skyline of Mount Tohivea, which stands nearly 4,000 feet above sea level. Your private transfer greets you at the dock before leading you to the Vaiare Harbor. The dramatic mountains roll along the edges of the water, framing the sailboat masts and reflecting in the clear waters of the bay. You walk along the wooden jetty leading to the serene promenade. Your private transfer greets you and happily leads you to the stunning resort and spa accommodations nestled between tranquil waters and lush mountains. The remainder of the day is yours to relax in the refreshing and romantic waters of the pool or stroll hand-in-hand along the nearly 20 acres of exotic gardens spreading into the foothills.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Sharing in the Experience
dayInfo.description: Moorea offers a mixture of dream-like landscapes with the romance of a secluded getaway. The lagoons shimmer with turquoise hues and the beaches glisten with white sand. The aroma of the sea fades beneath the scent of fresh crepes, connecting the island life with French colonial culture. The scenery resembles an exotic, lush garden from the breadfruit, oranges, pineapple, and coconuts growing in the trees to the adorning roadside markets filled with dried fruits and homemade jams. After breakfast, you make your way to the Moorea Dolphin Center. A retired navy officer started the facility with three bottlenose dolphins and a team of veterinarians and animal behaviorists. Locals and visitors from around the world have become educated on the ecology, environment, and interaction between dolphins through the center’s more than 20 years of research. The conservationist approach to the dolphins allows you to view the majestic animals up close without interfering with their lifestyle in the water. The dolphins are playful and intelligent. They can grow to more than 13 feet in length and have a sleek, sliver sheen. After visiting with the captivating dolphins, you continue to the Maison Blanche, an early 20th-century mansion depicting life for the aristocracy on the islands during the vanilla boom.

dayInfo.title: Moorea – Scenery of the Volcanic Landscape
dayInfo.description: Today you take the time to indulge in the sand and the gentle warmth of the early morning sunlight. The lagoon waters lap against the white sand shores of your resort. The pool trickles with sounds reminiscent of a fountain, adding to the leisurely ambiance of the day. After breakfast, you meet your guide in the lobby and board an open-air jeep for a 4x4 excursion over the hills and valleys of Moorea. The breeze brushes against your skin and carries the scent of guava and vanilla. You travel through the jungle roads to reach the top of Magic Mountain. You feel like you have been guided to a private view of the island on the summit at 685 feet above sea level. You have a panorama over the northern edges of Moorea. A sailboat catches the wind and drifts away from the bay. The indigo waters indicate a shallow reef wrapping around the far edges of the promontory. Near the end of the tour, your guide stops at a distillery known for producing rejuvenating juices and delicious liqueurs. A quick exploration of the plantations offers views of pineapple trees. Your guide pours a sample of the pineapple liqueur into a glass. The sweet and tart taste lingers on your palate before you recognize the subtle pineapple flavor.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – The Twin Peaks of Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: Moorea has seemed like a private island paradise offering a blend of romance and beauty around every corner. At breakfast, you enjoy the aroma of banana pancakes and the vibrant colors of the fresh fruit brought from the gardens of your resort, from papayas to oranges. Your private transfer greets you at the hotel and escorts you to Moorea Airport for your short flight to the island of Bora Bora. The island embodies your exotic fantasy with the Pacific Ocean shimmering with sapphire, indigo, and turquoise hues. The rainforest blankets the basal mountain peaks leading to the relaxed pace of the villages and glowing rainbow colors of coral reefs hidden in the crystal Clearwater. Your private transfer greets you at Bora Bora Airport and leads you to an unforgettable resort and spa located on the Motu Piti Aau islet. A blue lagoon and the sapphire Pacific waters wade against the edges of the exclusive property. The towering figures of the Mount Pahia and Mount Otemanu create a fascinating skyline over the island landscape. Settle into the relaxing ambiance of your resort with a couple’s spa treatment, lingering in the rejuvenating touch of a massage while in view of the tropical gardens and glistening lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – A Day in the Sea
dayInfo.description: Before breakfast, you take a romantic stroll in the Secret Garden of Love where couples have sealed their devotion to one another by placing locks on a palm tree. Lovers choose their symbol associated with Polynesian tradition, from a turtle to a seashell, each representing an important cultural tradition on the islands. You set the lock on a palm tree of your choosing and throw the key into the garden’s Tiki, which protects your love. After breakfast, you step onto a private catamaran and venture along the Pacific to visit the stunning coral reefs around the island in search of colorful tropical fish and manta rays. The boat glides over the gentle water sending sea spray into the air. The breeze brushes against your cheeks before you weigh anchor at your first snorkel spot near a huddle of rays. You jump into the water to find brain coral and sea fans along the seafloor. In the distance, the rugged mountains of the island rise above the edges of the water. You dip into the refreshing ocean and find a school of rays flying near the ocean. The water is clear up to 20 feet. The rays grow up to 23 feet wide and shimmer with black or dark blue hues. You can’t help but follow the school of rays as they glide along the ocean floor in search of food. In the evening, you make your way to a stunning seafood restaurant known for offering the freshest catch with each dish made to order.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – On the Roads of Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: The town of Vaitape bustles on Saturday mornings with food stalls drawing villagers from around the island. The aromas of clams marinated in coconut milk and airy donuts dusted with powdered sugar drift along the main street. Colorful sarongs match the vibrant colors of the exotic island landscape. After breakfast, you mount your bikes for a private couple’s biking tour around the island, traveling the more than 10 square miles at your leisure for a unique perspective of island life. The roads are empty along the water, allowing you to embrace the stunning views of the indigo colors leading to the sapphire water along the horizon. The palm trees rustle in the refreshing wind. The scent of coconut pervades the briny ocean air. Fruit vendors along the road offer full papayas and pineapples. They offer to open the fruits for patrons or drain the delicious, sweet juice into ice for a flavored snow cone. The aroma of banana bread emanates from the small roadside bakery. Mangoes dangle from the trees, and you can take some time to relax beneath the shade of the coconut palms while enjoying the view of a hidden lagoon.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Private Island Influence
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you delight in the aroma of fresh cappuccino mixing with the scent of fresh coconut. The previous bike ride around the island allowed you to view the stunning secluded beaches and hidden charms of Bora Bora for a unique, romantic shared experience. After breakfast, your private escorts you to the Bora Bora Airport for your brief flight to Raiatea. As the plane descends, you find lush jungle terrain overtaking the hills, mountains, and beaches, leading to a small manicured runway edged by water the color of precious gems. The tropical warmth returns to the day. You venture to the nearby marina and board a private boat bound for the island of Taha’a. Long, curved jetties lead from the sandy banks to the private bungalows above the water. Palm forest rises out of the low-lying landscape with views to the open sea and rising mountains of Raiatea in the distance. The relaxed atmosphere creates a harmony with the island and the water, allowing you to effortlessly settle into the comforts of your private suite. Your bungalow looks down into the crystal clear and kaleidoscoped colors of the lagoon. The scent of vanilla drifts out of the plantations at the heart of the island, adding an inviting fragrance to the daily life of fishing villages, pearl farms, and tranquil palm trees.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – Perfect Island Morning
dayInfo.description: The water quietly laps at the posts of your overwater bungalow in the morning. The indigo ocean flickers with the returning morning light. The sound of a ukulele hums against the rhythm of the water. A canoe arrives with a bright arrangement of fruits, juices, and a host of flavorful breakfast dishes including crepes. The navigator continues to strum the ukulele as you take the vibrant breakfast from the canoe for a fabulous meal on your private deck. The sweet watermelon and grapes contrast the orange citrus. The aroma of fresh coffee fills the air, accentuating the vanilla drifting over the water from the island shores. The remainder of the day is at your leisure to relish the beauty of island life and the comforts of your luxurious resort. You follow the scent of vanilla leading to the Maison de la Vanille, a family-owned estate offering insight into the vanilla cultivation process. Thousands of plants blossom on the estate with yellow and green pods. Your guide leads you through the flowering vanilla stalks before taking you into the drying room. The pods are heat-cured to develop the best flavor. During the process, the pods change colors from green to nearly black. The aroma intensifies during the process and continues to linger even after leaving the grounds.

dayInfo.title: Taha’a – A Pearl of the South Pacific
dayInfo.description: In the morning light, you can see a lone Tahitian paddling his canoe across the calm water. The palm trees on the island rustle in the gentle breeze of the early hours. You can hear the ukulele of the breakfast room service echoing from a nearby villa. The pearls at a family-run farm near the seashore glisten in the spreading light, highlighting the unique properties between each treasure. After breakfast, you take to the water, donning your snorkel mask and flippers, and indulging in the refreshing buoyant feeling of the Pacific. The current carries you from the reef at the edge of the atoll to the coral garden brimming with color and marine life. Soft coral flutters in the flow. A school of ray-finned fish glows with yellow scales and black tiger stripes. The hard coral rises out of the seafloor like a cactus, rolling like a hill until reaching the seagrass. The coral shines with pink and yellow hues reflecting in the rippling surface water. You float gracefully over the gardens and enjoy the natural beauty of the ocean. In the afternoon, you board a private catamaran to venture along the open water for a secluded sunset cruise.

dayInfo.title: Raiatea – At the Edge of the Honeymoon
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the aroma of hibiscus drifts over the gentle waves lapping along the golden sand beaches. You sip a delicate, frothy cappuccino and enjoy the view of the ocean. The small central market on the island fills with gorgeous produce, from bright oranges to bulbous pineapple. Shell necklaces and scented oils accentuate the bright aromas of the marketplace. Your private boat meets you at the dock after breakfast and escorts you back to the island of Raiatea. You reach the airport with plenty of time to check-in for your flight home, flying away from the emerald rainforests of French Polynesia and over the sapphire waters of the South Pacific.

tourName: New Zealand and Bora Bora Luxury Adventure Itinerary
placesVisited: Queenstown, Milford Sound, Rotorua, Waiheke Island, Tahiti, Bora Bora
generalInfo: New Zealand and Bora Bora are both dramatic volcanic islands cast adrift in the South Pacific and home to nature’s extravagance and enchantment. Both invite adventure from helicoptering to glacier exploration, sleeping amongst fjords and opening hobbit holes. Both regions also deliver with charm and long white beaches perfect for languid days of doing absolutely nothing. Five days in Tahiti and Bora Bora follow over a week spent in New Zealand on this handcrafted luxury tour for an immersion in the best of these incredible islands in the Pacific.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Enveloped by the Mountains of New Zealand’s South Island
dayInfo.description: Queenstown’s setting will captivate you as the whitened peaks of the Remarkables mountain range provide a backdrop and reflect softly in the serene water of Lake Wakatipu. Rugged hills stretch out into the distance, winding and rolling and swerving. Behind the small town is Ben Lomond, a cable car ascending to its summit and the complete Queenstown panorama. You will be greeted at the airport, and it is only a 15-minute transfer to your five-star hotel in the town and within easy walking distance of the lake and the cable car station. The day is at your leisure as you settle in, and the natural setting provides a relaxing introduction to New Zealand.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown – Lord of the Rings Movie Locations and Jet Boating Through a Canyon
dayInfo.description: You may already recognize some of the landscapes around Queenstown as swamps where armies collided, forests that hosted orcs, and farms and pastures that sang with stories from JRR Tolkien. Spend the morning on a Jeep tour of these landscapes, visiting up to a dozen filming locations from the Lord of the Rings, and then spend the afternoon in a lost landscape to ride a jet boat across the alpine waters of forgotten mountains. You can skid and swerve through the canyon, accelerating through a desolate landscape that is a baffling as it is beautiful. The night is at your leisure and Queenstown has many excellent restaurants for your consideration.

dayInfo.title: Milford Sound – Overnight Amongst the Mystique of the Fjords and Sounds
dayInfo.description: On the road west, you will sense the isolation of the South Island and the solitude of the Fjordlands. There is nothing on the road, just empty miles enveloped by mountains that rise starker and steeper. New Zealand’s sounds and fjords are found here, most of them inaccessible to visitors. Milford Sound is the narrowest, a dazzling stretch of water flanked by vertical mountains almost a mile in height. It is, justifiably, the country’s most famous natural attraction and a boat cruise provides an evocation of the beauty. Fully appreciating the splendor demands you spend the night, so will cruise out past waterfalls and wonders, and then drop anchor in the heart of Milford Sound as the mist swirls amongst the sunset. It will be silent with no other boats and tourists around. It will also feel surreal as you drift off to the sound of fur seals and the silence of the Sound.

dayInfo.title: Milford Sound to Queenstown – Helicopter Flight Over the Glaciers and Wines of Central Otago
dayInfo.description: Wake up to the mist as it drifts out of the canyon to reveal vertiginous cliffs and 300-meter waterfalls. In this early hour, you will feel like the early explorers as you are alone on a landscape as compelling as it is confounding. Rather than drive back from Milford Sound, you will take the aerial route as a helicopter provides magnificent views over the entire Fjordlands. Touch down on a glacier that is hidden between the mountain peaks and the solitude is absolute. A white landscape extends in all directions with strange ice sculptures carved into the mountain walls and cones and caves alive with the subtle blue of alpine waters. From Milford Sound, you were gazing up at nature’s drama, but on the glacier, it almost feels as though you are on the roof of the world. Touch down later in Queenstown, and a different pleasure fills your afternoon as behind the mountains is a cool, desert-like climate. The valley is rugged, seemingly too desolate for anything to grow but Pinot Noir grapes, cultivated in a new-world style, thrive. The taste is very different to the Pinot Noir of Burgundy, and many prefer its adventure and freedom. You will spend the afternoon visiting two or three vineyards, and the winemakers will introduce their creations for your enjoyment before you spend an evening in Queenstown at your leisure.

dayInfo.title: Queenstown to Rotorua – Bubbling Hot Pools and Immersion in Maori Culture
dayInfo.description: The Maori welcome you to Rotorua as they shout and posture, their story and culture shared through dramatic gestures and the haka, a war dance that is unique to the South Pacific islands. On their land, you find bubbling hot pools as steam rises above strange metallic colors and then the geyser explores, water spurting 15 meters into the air. Walk further along the trail, and another geyser explodes with the metronomic consistency of nature understood by your Maori guide. This afternoon you can visit the hot springs and geysers followed by an evening dining with the Maori at their national cultural center, a typical hangi meal cooked on hot stones beneath the ground. You can expect meats tenderly cooked for a full day and vegetables steamed to perfection alongside incredibly warm hospitality.

dayInfo.title: Rotorua – Outdoor Adventures on New Zealand’s North Island
dayInfo.description: While the South Island is marked by giant peaks, the North Island landscape is built from strange green hobbles and hills, another marker of volcanic power. Today’s private outdoor adventure will introduce you to these landscapes and a wide choice of activities. Mountain bike along the single-track trails in the forest, kayak across the remote lakes to natural hot baths, take a walk through the rolling hills that could have inspired Hobbiton, or combine all three activities as you get a sense of the land’s idiosyncrasy. There is even an option to take a white water raft down a narrow river, tumbling through the rapids and past the ferns. The evening is at your leisure can be spent enjoying the old-world feeling of the town and its people.

dayInfo.title: Hobbiton to Auckland to Waiheke – Hobbit Holes and Rolling Hills
dayInfo.description: Fastidious details maintain the world of make believe, and jam jars stand above gates painted with mold, rocking chairs seem fit for a hobbit, 44 circular holes grace a movie site that is completely untouched since filming. Some holes are tiny, made to make Gandolf look big when he walked past. Others are huge so that the hobbits would seem miniature through the oldest of filming techniques. Wander onwards, and follow the smoke to the Green Dragon Tavern where beer is served in goblets and the whole of Hobbiton is visible through the sloping window. Hobbiton is halfway between Rotorua and Auckland, an easy stop as you travel north. Upon arrival in New Zealand’s largest city, you will be transferred to the ferry terminal for the one-hour boat trip to Waiheke Island, where your hotel is perched delectably above the beach.

dayInfo.title: Waiheke – Art, Food, Wine and the Beaches of Tropical Waiheke Island
dayInfo.description: Vineyards fill the valleys of Waiheke as golden bays stretch out across the island, hidden behind hills and slopes. Cute villages seem stuck in the 1950s, with Mom and Pop stores and cafes. Old fish restaurants are complemented by something new world, with various fine dining options emerging on the island. Tourism on Waiheke has exploded in the last couple of years, and it has become the next big luxury destination to visit in the north of the country, yet it has retained a very laid-back feel. These two days are completely at your leisure. The beach may beckon, but there is also an excellent bus service to bring passengers on the 30-minute journey from one side of the island to the other. Alight at the vineyards, and it is possible to walk between them on a hiking trail that showcases a green and gold volcanic island perfect for easy exploration.

dayInfo.title: Auckland to Tahiti – Touching Down in French Polynesia
dayInfo.description: From Auckland there are direct flights to Tahiti, and only when you fly can you appreciate just how remote the French Polynesian islands are. From the north of New Zealand, you must fly for six hours across the waters of the Pacific Ocean with nothing beneath the wingtips but the deep blue of the ocean. Touch down in Tahiti, and you will spend the first night close to the airport at a hotel that offers barefoot access to the white sand. A traditional Tahitian welcome quickly gets you settled into the local atmosphere, one that favors tropical colors while valuing the tranquility of the coast.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – First Impressions of a White Sand Paradise
dayInfo.description: You will jump onto a short one-hour flight this morning as you swap Tahiti for the ultimate paradise of Bora Bora. Back-dropped by the magnificent Mount Otemanu, your boutique resort is only accessible by boat with a journey across the lagoon to a suite that is perched above the water. Stop to breathe in the silence, and you can fill your senses with the solitude and admire the views. Bora Bora is where you can stroll slowly and continue your day without any thought of time. This is an island where pleasure takes priority, from cocktails with your feet in the sand to Polynesian-inspired treatments in the spa, and ending each day with dining beneath the stars to the sight of palm trees silhouetted in the distance.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Lounging on the Sand and Drifting Off by Kayak or Sailboat
dayInfo.description: The days can be very lazy on Bora Bora, especially after you have just completed an adventure across New Zealand. Wake up late for breakfast to be delivered to your suite on a traditional canoe. Listen to the silence and inhale the tropical scents and then lie back on the sunloungers to drift off in the shade or the sun of your private balcony. Take a walk on the beach and enjoy such soft sand beneath your feet. In Bora Bora, it is okay to do nothing at all, and it is actually encouraged. But when you are ready, there is enough to keep you busy and ward off any thoughts of cabin fever. Kayaks and canoes are available, vessels for paddling across the lagoon and exploring lesser-seen parts of the island. You can go sailing with perhaps a short sunset cruise or an entire afternoon powered by the wind. Various activities are included in your stay, and they can be incorporated at any time over your time spent on Bora Bora.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Jeep Tour to Mount Otemanu and Traditional Culture in Vaitape
dayInfo.description: Mount Otemanu seems to call down to you as the stark granite slope has a magnetic pull over everything on Bora Bora. The slopes of the volcano are carpeted in green, and the forests and moss will engage you entirely. This morning, you will ascend, bumping towards the summit on a Jeep tour across the island. From anywhere up here, the panoramas are memorable with so many contrasting hues of green and blue also in the water below. When the tour continues, you will stop in the village of Vaitape to find that many old traditions continue to be practiced. The residents here have their own language and dance, cuisine and culture. Spend an hour with them, with much to learn from their permanently laid-back approach to life. Return to the resort as the afternoon continues as most afternoons on the island do as you lay back and relish the atmosphere.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Indulgence and Pleasures, Above and Below the Water
dayInfo.description: On your last day enjoying Bora Bora, there will be nothing to get up early for, unless you want to watch the rise of the sun over the South Pacific. Spend this day as you have the others as the natural appeal of the island allows you to plan nothing and indulge at every opportunity. The resort is low-key and values privacy over anything else, so drinks and meals can be served to your room, but there are also three small restaurants and three bars, including those on the sand and those for more formal dining. The activities continue to be part of your stay, kayaking, canoeing, sailing and hiking all a possibility. The snorkeling is always remarkable with such an array of tropical life found in the coral atolls skirting the island. Do everything, or do nothing at all as your tropical adventure soon concludes.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Departure
dayInfo.description: After two full weeks in the South Pacific, you will depart Bora Bora this morning, changing planes in Papeete in order to reach home.

generalInfo: Step into your customizable Bora Bora vacation and the natural splendor of the island will match any imagined paradise that two of you may have dreamed of. Tranquil beaches shimmer with powdery white sand as the lagoon glistens crystal clear with hues of indigo and turquoise. Snorkel amongst the blossoming coral gardens with magnificent manta rays nearby, and then float through the sky on a parasail. Indulge in the sweet and savory island flavors during a private cooking class, and then enjoy an enchanting cultural dance performance. Be captivated by the panoramas beneath the basalt summits, and then retreat into your luxury overwater bungalow or lounge on a private beach to relish the dreamscape of a Bora Bora getaway.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Arrive in the Charm and Beauty of Luxurious Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: If Tahiti is the crown of the South Pacific, then Bora Bora is its coveted jewel. Turquoise and indigo hues shine around the 11 square miles of the island edged by the ivory white sands found along the coastline. The scent of hibiscus permeates the air and accentuates the semi-sweet aroma of the sea as manta rays and angelfish swim in the crystal clear waters to reach the rainbow coral gardens. Your flight will descend into Bora Bora Airport and offer a remarkable first view of the soaring basalt peak of Mount Otemanu. Your private transfer will greet you both upon your arrival and escort you across the glistening waters of the lagoon to the sensational luxuries of your resort located on a private islet that overlooks the shores of Bora Bora. The dramatic peak of Mount Otemanu looms over the heart of the island as a background to your overwater bungalow. The sea breeze will rustle through the thistles on the thatch roof, and you can see sergeant majors swimming in the lagoon below through the glass floor panel at the heart of your suite. Your private plunge pool offers views to the white shores of Bora Bora and the soaring cliffs of Otemanu. In the evening, you can make your way to the restaurant on the property for a fabulous welcome of a Polynesian dinner and show. The scent of coconut milk emanates from the dish of Poisson Cru, which is made from raw tuna marinated in coconut and lime. The passionate rhythm of Toere drumbeats fills the air as dancers take to the stage to perform the traditional Tamure dance. The iconic beat increases to lead the dancers to shake their hips faster, swishing their grass skirts.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Engage with the Marine Life of Bora Bora with a Coral Gardens Tour
dayInfo.description: You will wake to the sounds of the water splashing against the wooden posts of your overwater bungalow as the lagoon laps against the white sands of the resort’s private beaches. At breakfast, the scent of banana will emanate from the dining room. The lively colors of dragon fruit and guava accentuate the thin and fluffy texture of the pancake. After the meal, your guide will greet you on the resort dock ready to escort you across the lagoon to find the remarkable coral gardens. The tropical sunlight will wash over your skin in the refreshing breeze of the speeding boat. You will reach the reef fringing a secluded islet, and the colors of the coral will seem muddled from above the water. You can jump into the lagoon and let the warm, soothing waters embrace you both, and then look beneath the sea to find a cache of kaleidoscope colors draping over the seafloor. The coral rises like a mixture of mountains and trees and teems with marine life. Moray eels hide in hidden caves and parrotfish will scurry away in timidity as you inch closer. A curious school of butterfly fish can swim between you and the reef with fish nearly nine inches long that glow with striking patterns of white, black, red, and orange. The crystal clear water allows visibility up to 20 feet, and the fish swarm around the colorful coral in search of plankton, sea anemones, or coral polyps. As you finish your swim, you can step onto the coral sands of the secluded beach to enjoy a relaxing picnic lunch with grilled fresh mahi-mahi.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Enjoy the Active Life on Bora Bora with a Day at your Leisure
dayInfo.description: In the morning, you can wake up slowly as the refreshing sea breeze will drift through your open window as a school of angelfish crossing beneath the glass floor panel at the heart of your overwater bungalow. At breakfast, the scent of passion fruit will accentuate the rich aroma of coffee brewed using beans cultivated from the French Polynesian islands. The day will be yours to embrace the beauty and the charm of Bora Bora at your leisure, allowing the two of you to relax on the hot white sands of the resort, lounge in the private waters of your plunge pool, or have an adventurous expedition into the Valley of the Kings on an invigorating hike. You can start the day with a magnificent panorama of Bora Bora during a parasailing excursion, or you can meet the speedboat on the resort dock and head out on the lagoon. The wind will brush through your hair as sporadic bursts of coconut aromas permeate the scent of the South Pacific. Your guide will secure you to your harness before you float into the air up to 30 feet above the water. The tranquil ambiance emphasizes the serene setting as the wind rustles the edges of the parasail, but otherwise, the air feels calm. Watch the boat moving against the crystal clear water below as you can see out to the reef bodies and the cobalt hues of the deeper South Pacific along the horizon. The sunlight will shine off the silver and black basalt cliffs of Mount Otemanu and its twin peak of Mount Pahia. Return to the boat to enjoy the scenic ride and the return of the wind brushing against your skin, and then perhaps visit a family-owned pearl farm to learn more about the precious, captivating stones.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Explore the Lagoon on a Private Shark and Ray Boat Safari
dayInfo.description: The glistening waters of the lagoon will call to you throughout the day as the pristine, crystal clear waters offer a sensational glow against the backdrop of the tropical island. Coconut palms cast thin shadows over the white, powdery sands of the shoreline and invite you to explore. After breakfast, you can set out together onto the lagoon once again to enjoy the treasures hidden beneath the sea. The boat weighs anchor at three specific locations, the first of which offers close-ups of marvelous manta rays. You can plunge into the water and will feel soothing beneath the heat of the tropical sun. The light pierces the shallows and offers tremendous visibility as you can touch your feet to the seafloor and still have your head above water. The manta rays swirl above the sands with wingspans reaching as wide as 23 feet. The rays venture close to the boat as your guide throws feed into the water. You can get a better look at their gills and the mouth located on the bottom of your flat bodies as they angle upwards towards the surface of the lagoon. Return to the boat and continue to the third snorkeling destination where blacktip reef sharks await your arrival. Your skipper will throw feed to the sharks and keep them focused in the water, so they will be uninterested in your arrival as you dip into the lagoon to view their five-foot long frame and dramatic presence. A fever of stingrays arrives and outnumbers the sharks, eager to find the food drifting through the water. Once back on board the boat, you can see how many rays and sharks have met you while in the water, easily spotting the distinct silhouettes in the clear water.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Venture into the Heart of Bora Bora with a 4x4 Jeep Expedition
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you will wake to the luscious aroma of banana pancakes for a bright start to the day for you both. As you are ready, you can venture together next to the shores of Bora Bora to meet your guide and board your open-air 4x4 jeep. The expedition will take you to the heart of Bora Bora in search of serene scenery and vibrant history, and you will exit the main road that circles the island to drive on the unpaved trails that crisscross the rainforest. The canopy shades the orchids that thrive in the tropical heat and prevalent moisture. Frangipanis radiate rich pink and opulent white colors on their waxy petals, and their sweet fragrance fills the air of the rainforest. You will reach a hilltop that offers a remarkable view of the indigo and turquoise water that guides your eyes to the crowning peak of Mount Otemanu along Faanui Bay, and take time together to enjoy it all. The US Navy rigged a coastal defense gun that overlooks the shores between Bora Bora and Raiatea during World War II. The preserved machinery continues to defend the island shores and recalls the turmoil of the South Pacific before the mid-20th century. You can continue to an ancient restored temple known as Marotetini Marae, which ancient Polynesians had dedicated to navigators. Stones overlook the shoreline beneath the shadow of the crowning stone, which reaches nearly 165 feet long and 10 feet tall. Turtle petroglyphs decorate a number of stones and symbolize the importance of the turtle in the daily life of ancient Polynesian culture.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Delight in the Comforts of Bora Bora at your Preferred Pace
dayInfo.description: The day is yours together to indulge in the splendors of Bora Bora at your preferred pace, whether it be by learning how to kite surf or by enjoying a leisurely bike ride around the island road. But before that, you can take in the flavors of Polynesian cuisine and learn about the influence of the French culture over more than a century. Make your way into the commercial kitchen of the resort to meet your private cooking instructor eager to teach you about dishes that burst with originality and the combination of regional flavors. Your instructor will welcome you with a cup of coffee made from beans sourced from Raiatea, the neighboring island. You will find hints of caramel and chocolate in the divine aroma, and then enjoy learning about the history and culture of Polynesian cuisine, focused on the delicious fruits, flowers, and marine life around the island. Sweet potatoes glow bright orange and tuna shimmers with a bright pink. You will prepare the first in a series of dishes and learn the ingredients of the celebrated Poisson Cru. A burst of lime fills the kitchen while the citrus helps to cook the raw, tender tuna as you mix the finely diced tuna with the coconut milk. Spend the afternoon enjoying the beaches and water as you would like. As the sun sets, you can then make your way to a celebrated restaurant to enjoy the thrilling ambiance found beneath the thatched-roof, atop the sand floors, and graced with the aroma of a sweet mango sauce.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Depart for Home
dayInfo.description: At breakfast, you will recall the vibrant flavors you discovered in your private cooking class the previous day, along with the celebratory ambiance the restaurant on the shores of the main island over dinner. After one last leisurely breakfast, your private transfer will take you both by boat to Bora Bora Airport. As your plane takes off, you can enjoy one more panorama of the idyllic tropical paradise of the island before arriving home.

tourName: Sydney and Bora Bora Luxury Honeymoon
generalInfo: From iconic thatched-roof huts to the sails of the Sydney Opera House, vivacious tropical fruits to the herbaceous aroma of eucalyptus trees, you will indulge in comfort, luxury, and romance during your customizable Sydney and Bora Bora honeymoon itinerary. Relish the cuisine of French Polynesia after a couple’s cooking lesson. Sample celebrated wines while enjoying the view of the endless vineyards. Dive into inviting waters to find glowing coral gardens and watch surfers carve the waves at a famous Australian beach. Whether in cosmopolitan Sydney or the secluded shores of Bora Bora, you can bask in beauty, pleasure, and passion.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – East Coast City Paradise
dayInfo.description: As your flight descends into Sydney, Australia, you find the arch of the Sydney Harbour Bridge framing the elegant sails of the iconic Opera House. The vibrant city glows with gold-sand beaches and turquoise waters, lush forests, and exotic gardens. The Sydney Tower crowns the skyline at nearly 1,015 feet above the surrounding streets. The Rocks shopping district has the oldest neighborhood in Sydney, with buildings dating back to the 19th century, decorated with their original stone facades. Your private transfer greets you at the airport upon your arrival and escorts you to a luxurious hotel offering unforgettable views of Darling Harbor and the boats gliding along the bay. The aroma of the ocean drifts along the streets of the Central Business District before disappearing beneath the subtle scent of orchids and jasmine growing in the Chinese Garden of Friendship. Your guide greets you at the hotel after you have had a chance to settle in, and leads you on a fabulous introductory tour of Australia’s stunning pearl by the beach, beginning at the Queen Victoria Building. The arcade was erected in the late 19th century as the city’s first shopping district. The grand sandstone architecture glistens beneath the endless coastal sunlight. Boutique and high-end shops line the interior with gilded window displays set beneath the central high dome. The original staircase wraps around the side of the dome offering stunning views of the kaleidoscopic stained glass windows.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Morning Near the Water
dayInfo.description: In the morning, the cafes of Sydney open to find artists, business people, students, and hipsters venture to one of Sydney’s premier cafes, which is simultaneously a coffeehouse, roastery, and bakery. The aroma of ground coffee beans blends with the scent of buttery pastries inside the renovated 19th-century pie house. After breakfast, your guide greets you in the lobby, eager to lead you on a private tour of Sydney’s most romantic and beautiful spots, eventually leading you to Bondi Beach. The golden shores of the small bay glisten in the sunlight. Surfers carve the waves breaking to the south. Beachgoers sunbathe on blankets or bask in the shade of their umbrellas brought from home. The promenade fills with joggers, couples strolling, and restaurants with open windows to bring in the sea breeze. The beach is one of the city’s most famous, known for the reality television show Bondi Rescue and its pristine beauty. You return to the harbor in the afternoon and board a catamaran bound for the waters of Port Jackson. The main and beautiful waterway of the city fills with sails, adding an elegant flutter to your view of lush hills, the scattered city skyline, and elegant homes overlooking the canals. The sun begins to set, layering the sky over the city with shades of saffron and crimson. The boat inches closer to the harbor, allowing you to share in the sunset over the prestigious sails of the Sydney Opera House.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – Divine in the Blue Mountains
dayInfo.description: The coffee culture of the chic neighborhood of Surrey Hills emanates from a hidden café. The secret blend of beans and spices brings Sydney dwellers from across the city to enjoy the frothy cappuccinos and zesty espressos before starting their day. Surfers take to the water, boats set sail along the canals, and the enticing aroma of the sea permeates the bustle of the Central Business District. After breakfast, your guide greets you in the hotel lobby and escorts you to Blue Mountains National Park. A blue veil spreads over the eucalyptus forest in the morning light caused by natural vapors lifting from the trees. The dense canopy overtakes the valleys and leads to the edges of the sandstone mountain ridges. The plateaus reach more than 3,600 feet above sea level, connecting to more than 60 miles of trails. The drive takes you along windy roads through the dense forest before arriving at the viewpoint over Govetts Leap. The copper tones of the sandstone stand out on the cliffs over the emerald forest canopy sweeping through the valley below. The thin stream of Bridal Veil Falls tumbles into the forest at a height of 590 feet. The eucalyptus forest provides a herbaceous aroma to the landscape. You continue to the Three Sisters to view the gorgeous karsts rising nearly 3,000 feet above the Jamison Valley below.

dayInfo.title: Sydney – The Simple Pleasures of Hunter Valley
dayInfo.description: The morning light washes over the roses growing in the Royal Botanic Gardens. Birds twitter in the warming air and search the soil for food. Couples stroll through the tranquil gardens to enjoy the soft aromas of the blossoming flowers and views of the harbor from Mrs. Macquarie’s Chair, a sandstone-carved bench overlooking Sydney Harbour. Your private driver meets you at the hotel after breakfast and leads you to the stunning scenery and celebrated flavors of Hunter Valley. The romantic ambiance of the landscape is reminiscent of Napa Valley or the South of France. Narrow lanes crisscross one another along the lush greenery of the valley. Gourmet restaurants rise out of endless rows of vineyards near boutique breweries and hidden confectionaries. Local farms produce homemade marinated olives and delightful cheeses, which local restaurateurs utilize in their celebrated dishes. Your guide leads you to a centrally located winery celebrated for its talented winemakers and their attention to detail in appealing to casual consumers and connoisseurs alike. The warm air of the valley sweeps over the leaves of the vineyard. The cellar has a refreshing, consistent cool atmosphere, pleasantly contrasting the landscape. In the tasting room, your guide pours you a sample of the pinot noir within view of the sprawling vines of the estate. You find the aroma of cherry and violets lifting from the glass. You sip the light body and notice a balance of earthy and fruity flavors giving way to a subtle oak finish.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Grand Island Getaway
dayInfo.description: The boats in the harbor weigh anchor and set their sails in the morning light, gliding alongside the promontory of the Sydney Opera House. The rooftop was designed to resemble the sails of a ship setting out to sea. The surfers venture to Manly Beach to catch the waves breaking along the stretch of sapphire water. The shops in the Queen Victoria Building open their doors in the sunlight pouring through the decorative domes at the heart of the arcade. Your private transfer greets you in the lobby after breakfast and escorts you to Sydney Airport for your flight to Bora Bora in French Polynesia. The twin peaks of Mount Pahia and Mount Otemanu create the lush skyline towering over the exotic jungle canopy. The mountains reach heights of 2,385 and 2,160 feet respectively, offering a dramatic first impression as your flight descends into Bora Bora Airport. The South Pacific waters shimmer with sapphire hues leading to indigo and turquoise near the shoreline. The dreamy setting blends with a relaxed island pace for a perfect ambiance. Your private transfer greets you upon your arrival at the airport and escorts you by boat to the narrow sand-fringed islet located on the outer coral reef. The Pacific brushes against the pristine white beaches to the west with the tranquil lagoon bordering the resort to the east. The scent of coconut drifts through the resort, blending with the soft aroma of the seaside. You settle into the tropical comforts for which French Polynesia is known, finding luxury and seclusion in your iconic overwater bungalow.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Beauty in the Wildlife
dayInfo.description: The honeymoon continues when you wake in the paradise of Bora Bora. The scent of pineapple and coconut fills the air, with the emerald hues of the rainforest glistening against the returning light. You can look out of your private overwater bungalow to find the shimmering crystal clear waters of the South Pacific below. Schools of colorful fish swirl around the water before fading into the distance. The mountain peaks continue to loom over the island, shaped by volcanic activity more than a million years ago. After breakfast, you board a private boat and set out towards the open water in search of whales and dolphins cruising through the Pacific. Sea spray splashes upwards from the hull of the boat and leaves droplets on your cheeks. You dip your fingers into the water to find the ocean refreshingly cool against the tropical sun. The whales migrate around the islands between June and December, leaving behind the Arctic waters, and often lingering near the island reef. Your boat has a silent motor to not disturb the whales swimming close by. You put on special headphones to hear the humpbacks singing beneath the surface water. The melodic calls linger in your ears before you find the tail of a humpback breaching.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – Island Life on Wheels
dayInfo.description: Bask in the beauty of your private bungalow and enjoy the pleasurable aroma of mangos and oranges in the morning air. At breakfast, you sip a rejuvenating cappuccino accompanied by fresh coconut. The day is yours to explore the island at a leisurely pace while cycling along the coastal roads and trails. Secluded paths lead to hidden coves and beaches filled with turquoise water. White sands glisten in the tropical light. Coconut trees curve into the sky with leaves rustling in the light breeze. In the mountain ridges, you find houses that resemble thatched huts, offering views of remarkable tree lines leading out to the water. Local fishermen glide over the water in outrigger canoes and set out nets in search of their daily catch. Fruit stands are set up on the side of the road, with vendors lounging in the shade. They offer to cut open coconuts and guavas, juicing the fruit over ice or offering the sweet shaved interior of the coconut as a delicious snack. The entire island is more than 10 square miles and enchants you around every bend. The scent of hyacinths fills the air, and you stop at the Coastal Defense guns to view the preserved WWII heavy artillery that was once meant to protect the island from foreign invasion.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – In the Comforts of Bora Bora
dayInfo.description: Bask in the refreshing aroma of citrus fruits and coconuts at breakfast. The natural fragrance of the tropics accentuates the fresh, sea air. The day is yours to experience the abundant activities of your resort at your leisure, relishing the hot, white sands along the shoreline and embracing the views of Mt. Otemanu soaring above the lagoon. Start your morning with a paddleboard excursion to experience the mixture of thrill and relaxation. You take the heavy board onto the clear, indigo water. The weight on the board helps balance you along the gentle wake of the lagoon. A refreshing breeze blows through the palm trees on the shore. The cool air brushes against the water stuck to your skin. You slowly paddle twice on the left and twice on the right to help guide you straight, parallel with the island. After returning to the resort, you can settle into the comforts of the spa. The scent of coconut returns inside the private room. The soothing fragrance helps relax you before your masseuse soothes your muscles during a sensual couple’s massage. The open-air hut offers privacy and the natural sounds of the water lapping against the sand. You can feel the breeze rush beneath the thatched roof. Sharing in the calming, sensual experience helps bring you closer together with your loved one.

dayInfo.title: Bora Bora – The Grandeur of the Inner Island
